Mega Laser Show To Tackle Pollution, Indian Economy Continues To Fall + More Top News

A mega Diwali laser show will be organised by the Delhi government in the national capital to dissuade people from bursting crackers. Read more

Here's more top news of the day:

1) Indian Economy Continues To Fall, Jobs Gone But Key Ministers In Modi Govt Chant All Is Well

PM Modi roared at the top of his voice that all was well back in the country but he made no note of rising unemployment, layoffs and the falling economy. Read more

2) India Headed Into A ‘Dark And Uncertain’ Path, Warns Raghuram Rajan On Rising Authoritarianism

Don't Miss 1.9 K SHARES 145 SHARES

Former Reserve Bank of India governor Raghuram Rajan, who is known for his severe criticism of the PM Narendra Modi-led ruling BJP dispensation in India on the economic front, has fired a fresh set of salvos in which he has observed that India is headed into a “dark and uncertain path” as a result of majoritarianism and authoritarianism. Read more

3) Delhi’s Air Quality Plummets Ahead Of Diwali, Expected To Deteriorate Further Due To Stubble Burning

As the festive season approaches, Delhi’s air quality has plummeted to “Poor” level after the residents breathed better air than corresponding periods in the last few years. Read more

4) Noida Researchers Discover Plastic-Eating Bacteria And It's Good News For Tackling Plastic Waste

Researchers have discovered two strains of 'plastic-eating' bacteria from the wetlands of Greater Noida, an advance that may lead to eco-friendly alternative clean-up methods for plastic waste worldwide. Read more

5) Madhya Pradesh Journalist Files One RTI Application, Gets 360 Responses. More To Come

A social worker and journalist from Bhopal filed an RTI application addressing the Postal Department seeking information about the post office, its premises and its housing complex. Read more
